revised_title: Investigation of the Chemical Action of Bacillus Lactis Aerogenes on Glucose and Mannitol
tldr: The authors study the fermentation process of glucose and mannitol by Bacillus lactis aerogenes, discovering the production of 2:3-butyleneglycol and acetylmethylcarbinol. The findings indicate that the fermentation process is different from that of B. coli communis, and the missing carbon is possibly due to the presence of reduction products of sugar.
